page.title: 13Cottingham Cemetery
page.content: I was very surprised when we visited our village's own cemetery as I did not realise we had one. The cemetery is divided into two parts; the old part and a more recent one. At the entrance to the plot there is a lodge and a small chapel. There were many old graves. Among the oldest set of graves running along the edge of the cemetery there was a special area for infants and small children. The youngest person we found was only five months old when he died in 1899. Lots of the gravestones were very moss covered. The oldest person to be buried in the cemetery died at the age of 101. In another area of the cemetery there were no graves, just name plates and dates. I think these people must have been cremated.
